service.title: 2. Reli Service
service.part1: 2.1. The provision of the Reli Service is free of charge for the End Customer.
service.part2: 2.2. The provision of the Reli Service to the End Customer takes place as follows:

service.part5: the Company sends the End Customer a confirmation of receipt of the order, at which point the Contract for the purchase of Goods between the End Customer and the Company is concluded;

In the case of cash on delivery, the Partner or the contracted carrier delivering the Goods collects cash or cashless payments from the End Customer.

ordering.title: 4. Ordering and Concluding a Contract for the Purchase of Goods

The End Customer shall pay the price in accordance with paragraph 2.2. letter d).
ordering.part3: 4.3. After the End Customer has placed an order, the Company shall send the End Customer a confirmation of receipt of the order, thereby concluding a Contract for the Purchase of Goods between the End Customer and the Company.

complaints.title: 7. Complaints Procedure
complaints.part1: 7.1. The End Customer may exercise their right arising from defective performance (complaint) in connection with the Goods through the Application or Portal in accordance with this Complaints Procedure.
complaints.part2: 7.2. These Complaints Procedure Rules govern the exercise of rights arising from liability for defective performance under Contracts for the Purchase of Goods concluded between the Company and the End Customer through the Reli Service.
complaints.part3: 7.3. The scope of liability for defective performance is governed, to the extent not regulated by these GTC, by the relevant provisions of the Civil Code and, if the End Customer is a consumer, also by Act No. 634/1992 Coll.
complaints.part4: 7.4. The Company shall handle complaints within 30 days of their delivery.
complaints.part5: 7.5. When filing a complaint, the End Customer must provide the order number, a description of the defect, and the desired method of handling the complaint.
complaints.part6: 7.6. The End Customer may, as a right arising from defective performance, request the following as part of the complaint handling process:
complaints.part9: A reasonable discount on the price of the Goods;
complaints.part10: Withdrawal from the contract and a refund of the price of the Goods.
complaints.part11: 7.7. If the End Customer requests the settlement of a complaint under points a), b), or d) of the previous article, they shall send the Goods to the Partner's address, which the Company shall provide to them via the Application or the Portal.
complaints.part12: 7.8. In the event of a justified complaint, the Company shall comply with the requested method of handling the complaint by the End Customer. If the End Customer requests Repair of the Goods, the Company is also entitled to handle the complaint by replacing the Goods (Delivery of a new item).
complaints.part13: 7.9. In the event of an unjustified complaint, the Company shall inform the End Customer that it does not accept the complaint and, if the End Customer has sent the Goods back to the Partner, the Partner shall send the Goods back to the End Customer.
complaints.part14: 7.10. In the event of a justified complaint, the customer shall not bear the costs associated with its enforcement, this also applies to the costs of returning the Goods to the Partner.
complaints.part15: 7.11. In the event of an unjustified complaint, the Company may require the End Customer to pay the costs of transporting the Goods from the End Customer to the Partner and back if the Goods were transported in connection with the complaint.
complaints.part16: 7.12. These Complaints Rules form an integral part of every Contract for the Purchase of Goods.
